title: How to go to Barcelonnette, France
text:
More informations available here: https://seolane.org/
The adress of Seolane center is :
Pôle d’accueil universitaire Séolane
Quartier du 11è BCA
Chemin des Casernes
04400 Barcelonnette
By Train
you can take a train to Gap (Paris-Gap by night for example or Marseille-Gap). Then, you take the bus 535 (Gap-Barcelonette, see https://www.autocars-scal.fr/) wich leaves you 15 minutes’ walk from the Séolane center.
By Bus from Marseille
See https://www.autocars-scal.fr/ for the bus map and schedule.
Depending on your schedule, you can take the Bus 28 which is direct:

For Sunday, the 17th of November, you have the Bus number 28 at 7:00 am at Gare St Charles de Marseille, that arrives at 11:30 am at Barcelonnette, or you have the travel 16:30 pm (Marseille) to 20:00 (Barcelonette), then 15 minutes’ walk. see the pdf
For Friday, the 22th of November, you have 15 minutes’ walk, then the Bus number 28 at 16:45 pm at Barcelonette that arrives at 20:00 at Gare St Charles de Marseille see the pdf
or you can take the 69 bus, then the 535 bus.

By car you can book a car in Gap or in Marseille.

title: Planning
text:
For 2024, courses will be about general courses: using crocotools (matlab toolbox), creation of your own configuration, zoom agrif, adding river…


courses and pratical courses PDF for the 2024 training
You can find the PDF of the courses and pratical courses for the 2024 training here:

Jour 1 - 01 - intro speech
Jour 1 - 02 - intro croco
Jour 1 - 03 - set a configuration
Jour 1 - 04 - architecture of croco sources
Jour 1 - 05 - test cases
Jour 2 - 01 - crocotools

title: TRAINING CROCO (PSF 2024 IRD)
text:
The aim of the CROCOFOSUD 2024 school is to learn how to use the CROCO 3D ocean code (https://www.croco-ocean.org/). It is aimed at people with an oceanography background who are either beginners or who wish to reinforce their knowledge of the general concepts of CROCO.
The course will take place from Monday, the 18th to Friday, the 22nd of November 2024 in Barcelonnette in the Alps, France. We recommend that you arrive the day before, on November 17th. For more information on the location, click on the How to go tab.

News
 We will soon contact the participants with the final details before their arrival (computer, meals, etc.). 


Organisation
Planning: see planning of the training - beginner training
Language: French and English if necessary
Registration deadline: closed but there is still one or two spots left. Do not hesitate to contact us.
Cost :

Free for participants from the south. They can also request financial assistance from the IRD for transport.
See Cristele Chevalier (cristele.chevalier@mio.osupytheas.fr) for the cost for participants from the north (this includes accommodation and meals).
Participants must pay for their own transport



Requierements :

knowledge of unix
an oceanography background
a laptop to attend the course
This training is funded by IRD (https://www.ird.fr/) as part of the Projet Structurant de Formation CROCOFOSUD .

title: Documentation
text:
You will find documentations in:

https://www.croco-ocean.org/download : CROCO source code, Datasets, Tutorial configurations, …
https://data-croco.ifremer.fr/DOC/PRES_TRAINING_CROCO_2023_Barcelonette/ : pdf of previous courses of PSF 2023
https://forum.croco-ocean.org/ : forum for help
https://gitlab.inria.fr/croco-ocean : CROCO gitlab with CROCO, croco_tools in Matlab and Python

title: Registration
text:
04-2024: We are now accepting applications. You can send your application to camille.mazoyer@ird.fr and cristele.chevalier@mio.osupytheas.fr.
Please include the following information in your application email:
Name:
First name:
Organisation:
Country:
Background in oceanography:
Knowledge of Unix:
Knowledge of CROCO or another ocean model:
For people from the South:
Contact person from your laboratory or IRD contact:
Would you like the IRD to contribute to your transport?
